reviewText: This 2010 Danish movie centres around 34 year old Mads (Thure Lindhardt) who has lived with girlfriend (Tuva Novotny) for the last ten years. Mads then starts to question where is his life going and is he with the right girl. The movie then explores Mads meetings with several other girls, the future in-laws, and Mads attempts at the perfect screenplay. For the time being he is found writing scripts on the TV series Strisser (Cop). The movie has its comedy moments and the 90 minutes of the film does pass fairly quickly. Lindhardt is one of Denmark's leading male actors at present and he gives a worthy performance in this movie supported by Swedish actress Tuva Novotny. Fans of the original Danish The Killing (Forbrydelsen) Complete Season 1 (20 Episodes on 5 DVDs) will recognise Lars Mikkelsen (Troels), Nikolaj Kopernikus (Vagn) and Kim Bodnia (Bulow) in very minor roles along with Nicolas Bro (Buch) from The Killing - Season 2. Danish film makers often make some excellent contributions to the film industry and this is certainly one of them. Enjoy.
